metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5444 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Geary before 0.6.3 does not present the user with a warning when a TLS certificate error is detected, which makes it easier for remote attackers to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks via a crafted certificate.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5444` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

geary - 0.6.3-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: geary package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.6.3-1ubuntu1').
